ratings.comment: Brian is there with you every step of the way. Cares about math, but cares more about people. Challenging material made accessible through his articulate and broad lecturing style.
He didn't assign homework from a book, but made some up online homework. He forgot to make homework for around a month, and so I felt very unprepared for the midterms.

Brian himself is a likeable guy, that being said, being a Prof isn't his strong suit. 2 midterms, both hard with averages below 60%, if you want to succeed you really have to be self motivated, I would suggest joining GUTS and Math Tutorial. Post practice problems occasionally, same goes for homework, but not too reliable. Doesn't reply to email.

This class was absolutely ridiculous. I went to every lecture even though it didn't help me at all. The exams were extremely long and the equationsquestions were way more advanced than anything gone over in lecturediscussion. Professor writes every word he says on the board, which is really annoying!

David Dynerman is the  best, most chilled TA.  Professor Cook is a wonderful man. He is funny but sometime his lecture could be very confusing. His exam guides are nothing like the exams. Exam are long and hard. My class average is always around the 50. But that also  means that if you secure 70 or more, you are guaranteed an A.

The "textbook" that they have you get is a joke. It is very confusing and sometimes very different from what they teach in class. The examples that he goes over in lecture make little sense and are very different from what he puts on exams. At the beginning of the year he assigned weekly homework, which was helpful, but ultimately just gave up.

Completely uninterested in helping the undergrad students.  Assigned homework for like 3 weeks and then gave up. The text book is completely unhelpful. I took AP Calc in high school and his lectures consistently left me baffled - so I stopped going and my grade went UP...

It's Calc 1.  seems simple enough right?  the majority of the class has already taken this exact class in high school and already have a decent command of the subject material.  Unfortunately, Brian thinks the class is a game and he constantly gives the most confusing examples on the exam and never touches anything like them in lecture or discus.

He does not give any help. He writes everything he says on the board which makes for choppy sentence and little explanation as he is constantly trying to keep up writing it on the board. He never replies to anyone's emails, I guess not even to my TA. He is not clear on when there is homework due and assigns different end times. I really dislike him
He is a very good teacher. I learn a lot from his lectures. The text book is necessary!!!!!!!
